oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A COUPLED RANS-VOF AND FINITE ELEMENT MODEL FOR WAVE INTERACTION WITH HIGHLY FLEXIBLE VEGETATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chen, Haifei
Zou, Qingping
Liu, Zhilong
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave interaction with vegetation
flexible vegetation
large deflection
IHFOAM
OpenFOAM
RANS-VOF
finite element method
immersed boundary method
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper presents a coupled wave-vegetation interaction model suitable for very flexible vegetation with large deflections. The wave hydrodynamics is modeled by a Navier-Stokes flow solver along with a Volume of Fluid surface capturing method. The governing equation for flexible vegetation motion is solved by a Finite Element Method using a semi-implicit time differencing scheme. The coupling between wave hydrodynamics and vegetation motion is achieved using an immersed boundary method. The model is validated with experimental measurements for a single-stem vegetation and a large-scale vegetation patch in a wave flume.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 35 (2016): Proceedings of 35th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Antalya, Turkey, 2016; waves.25
